thread.title: Badass Toddler Shoots Himself Free From A Locked Car Like A Mini Jason Bourne
thread.title_full: Badass Toddler Shoots Himself Free From A Locked Car Like A Mini Jason Bourne

author: Chaps
title: Badass Toddler Shoots Himself Free From A Locked Car Like A Mini Jason Bourne
text:
Badass Toddler Shoots Himself Free From A Locked Car Like A Mini Jason Bourne Chaps | Email 
DELTONA, Fla. – A 30-year-old Deltona woman was arrested Monday afternoon after a 3-year-old boy grabbed her loaded gun and shot out the window of a car parked at a church school, the Volusia County Sheriff’s Office said. 
Abbie Maldonado had the toddler in the car with her when she drove to the Good Shepherd Academy on Howland Boulevard to pick up her son from school shortly before 3:45 p.m., Sheriff’s Office spokesman Gary Davidson said. 
“Maldonado got out to walk around and left the boy unsecured in the back of the vehicle with the rear passenger door propped open so she could keep an eye on the child,” Davidson said. 
Talk about improvising, adapting, and overcoming adversity. This young fellas was about to die in a hot car. Fuck that. He was gonna grab his momma’s loaded gun and fire off a couple shots so he could stay in the hot car like a cricket in a pickle jar with a few holes punched in the top. Could he have lived in that car for weeks? No. Just like the cricket, he’ll die eventually no matter how many holes he shoots through the windshield. But, just like the cricket, having those holes will certainly extend the length that he can stay in there. 
So, if we have any toddler stoolies reading, make you sure you grab your parent’s guns and shoot the shit out of the windshield. It’ll make it cooler in the car and increase your chances of survival. 
Now, I know what the rest of you are thinking. 
“Hey Chaps. Isn’t telling children to shoot the windshield of their parent’s car just a little irresponsible?” 
No. Windshields are shatter proof. It’s perfectly safe. Thanks, though. 
That being said, sign this little dude up to be on my team any day. I used to hate when my mom would leave me in the car. This little fella had a long day at daycare and then his mom tries to leave him in the car while she chats it up with her pals? I wish I had the gumption to pull the trigger and cause some damage when my mom “just had to run in for some bread and milk.” Sure, mom. It was fucking hot in there and you took FOREVER. Chaps |
